name: Shivaleela Uppula
title: Principal Network & Data Center Engineer - SDWAN, Multi-Tenant Architecture, Cloud Security
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in designing, automating, and securing multi-data-center, multi-tenant network architectures with a focus on SDWAN, VXLAN/EVPN, and PCI-DSS compliance across Healthcare, Insurance, Government, and Finance domains.

Architected a scalable multi-tenant network fabric for a major healthcare provider using VXLAN and EVPN to isolate sensitive PHI data streams, which required meticulous BGP route-target configurations and passed rigorous internal HIPAA security audits.

Orchestrated the migration from traditional MPLS cores to a secure SDWAN overlay for a financial services client, implementing Python-based automation for zero-touch provisioning that reduced deployment cycles from weeks to hours.

Engineered high-availability BGP designs with fast convergence for critical insurance claim processing systems, utilizing route dampening and OSPF/BGP redistribution tweaks learned through iterative troubleshooting sessions.

Developed Ansible playbooks with Jinja2 templates to automate the deployment of secure edge controls and DDoS mitigation policies across hundreds of network devices, ensuring consistent PCI-DSS compliance posture.

Led the design of a multi-data-center interconnect utilizing cloud peering and NFV principles on AWS, creating resilient pathways for real-time data replication that withstood simulated zone failures.

Implemented comprehensive internet peering strategies with strict access-control lists and monitoring to protect government citizen data portals from external threats, balancing public access with security mandates.

Diagnosed complex network performance issues in a multi-vendor SDWAN environment by analyzing flow data and tweaking QoS policies, which restored VoIP clarity for telehealth applications after a frustrating week of packet loss.

Configured and optimized EIGRP for legacy healthcare inventory systems during a gradual migration to a BGP-based fabric, maintaining operational continuity while modernizing the underlying network architecture.

Automated compliance checks for firewall rules and routing policies using Python scripts that interfaced with Cisco and Fortinet APIs, generating audit trails that satisfied both internal and external regulators.
Designed and troubleshot a scalable VXLAN infrastructure supporting thousands of tenants for a Blue Cross Blue Shield project, isolating test, production, and development environments effectively.
Managed the full lifecycle of SDWAN controller deployments, including software upgrades and policy push, ensuring minimal disruption to 24/7 financial trading and settlement operations.

Collaborated with security teams to integrate NFV-based next-generation firewalls into the SDWAN data path, enabling secure segmentation for different business units within a shared physical infrastructure.

Built Python tools to parse BGP neighbor tables and OSPF LSDBs, providing real-time visibility into network topology changes and accelerating mean-time-to-resolution for outages during on-call rotations.

Championed the adoption of infrastructure-as-code principles for network deployment, using Ansible to enforce golden configurations and drift detection, which eliminated several manual configuration errors.
Spearheaded a proof-of-concept using agentic frameworks (CrewAI) to analyze network telemetry data, creating a prototype that could correlate SDWAN events with application performance degradations.
Mentored junior engineers on multi-data-center design principles and troubleshooting methodologies, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and meticulous documentation within the network team.
Continually researched emerging trends in network automation and security, applying lessons from conferences and labs to enhance the reliability and security of enterprise data center networks.

Cloud & SDN Platforms: AWS Networking (VPC, Direct Connect, Transit Gateway)
